title: Hey Riot, honestly, thanks for the hextech restrictions for non-reformed players. It's a great move.
body:
So, I have only been playing a couple months, but I was warned that the community could be rough, and boy, was that right. League has a serious problem with toxic players. I have relatively thick skin thanks to several years of playing other online games, but even I get occasionally blindsided by a player's words to the point where I'm actually shaken or disturbed. 

Suspensions and even bannings seem to have only moderate impact. People are capable of making new accounts, and indeed often have several active. Perhaps they're confident they can avoid punishment. Perhaps they're prepared for it. I'm not sure. It's like how, in the US justice system, mandatory minimum sentencing laws are frequently demonstrated to not actually reduce crime.

But now? You hit potentially toxic individuals at their bottom line. I now get to enjoy products that they can't get. For MONTHS. You made being a player in good standing something that truly matters, and you even had the balls to make this determination retroactive, so that somebody punished a month before Hextech Crafting went live that wasn't considered "reformed" still can't participate. I love it. It's a master stroke.

It would have been easy for you to make this new content available for everybody, but you guys have shown real vision and guts to take a stance against the toxic players within this community. I have high hopes for Hextech Crafting to make a real dent in the numbers of people willing to ruin the game for others. Thank you.

That's entirely false. Multiple reports in a single game don't have a cumulative effect on your standing as a player. A single game can't count against you more than once. You'd need to break the rules multiple times across multiple games in order to have actions taken against you.
Some league players have a hairpin trigger for reporting.  It often is their own way of being toxic.
Unless you're doing something worth reporting, those reports don't count for anything.

Aye... additionally those who report exceedingly often are usually bound to have a considerably lower value attached to their reports as false positives pile up over time. Quite a few systems set up in such a manner have these things built in to curb abuse cases of automated systems.

One: It's three. Three 'substantiated' reports, with no 'minimum period' in between- you can be punished inside of an hour, with three surrender-20 games. The reports can all come from the same person or premade, as long as the system detects hostile language- context does not matter. There are indeed trolls who bait out the words 'please report' to get other players punished- check the Player Behavior thread, it works. "Report" in all chat is enough to substantiate a report.

 Two: You have obviously never had your series tanked by a troll who continues to tell you that YOU are worthless for not meeting their demands. You have obviously never experienced the intense frustration of Riot placing you in B5 after an excruciating climb to B2. The toxicity that will get you punished is ANY kind of lashing out at the people that get off on making your game miserable.

Three: I deal with clinical depression. I'm miserable a lot. Why in the world should I be punished at all for being angry, instead of miserable, when someone goes out of their way to make my game suck? 

Four: Toxic behavior is a misnomer. Riot punishes toxic language and nonparticipation, regardless of context. If you get bugsplatted several times in a row, it counts toward LeaverBuster- even if you get in eventually. Same for if your power goes out, if the phone rings and you don't want to risk feeding, etc. Similarly, you get punished for calling the guy feeding and blaming the jungler an asshole, or for asking the other team to report him- but if you decide to intentionally feed or otherwise make a mess of the game (No jg, 3 bot, for example) to make your teammate's game suck, Riot CANNOT detect it with any consistency. They don't want to punish NORMAL feeders, so they punish no feeders. They don't want to punish OFF-META picks, so they don't punish players using them to intentionally ruin games. Etc.

Please provide a source for this three report number you have. I'd like to add it to my common questions about reports thread here: [Multiple reports and other misconceptions (via boards.leagueoflegends.com)](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/tvviuURj-multiple-reports-and-other-misconceptions)

As you can see I keep all the information as up to date and accurate as possible, citing Riot official sources for each point. It really helps combat confusion so I'd appreciate your help.
